A method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure, comprising:providing a base;forming initial bit lines on the base, and forming semiconductor channels on surfaces of the initial bit lines away from the base, along a direction that the base points to the initial bit line, the semiconductor channel comprising a first doped region, a channel region and a second doped region arranged in sequence;forming a first dielectric layer covering sidewall surfaces of the first doped regions, and a first interval being provided between parts of the first dielectric layer covering sidewalls of adjacent first doped regions on a same initial bit line;forming an insulating layer covering sidewall surfaces of the channel regions;forming word lines covering a sidewall surface of the insulating layer away from the channel regions, and a second interval being provided between adjacent word lines;forming a second dielectric layer covering sidewall surfaces of the second doped regions, and a third interval being provided between parts of the second dielectric layer located on sidewalls of adjacent second doped regions; and the first interval, the second interval and the third interval connecting and exposing a part of the initial bit line; andmetalizing the part of the initial bit line exposed, to form a bit line, and a material of the bit line comprising a metal semiconductor compound.

13. The method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure according to claim 12, after the forming word lines, and before the forming a second dielectric layer, the method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure further comprises:forming an initial transition layer on top surfaces of the second doped regions away from the base through an epitaxial growth process, the initial transition layer and the second doped region being doped with a same type of a doped ion, a doping concentration of the doped ion in the initial transition layer being greater than a doping concentration of the doped ion in the second doped region, the doped ion being one of N-type ion or P-type ion, and an orthographic projection of a part of the initial transition layer on the base being greater than an orthographic projection of the second doped region on the base.

14. The method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure according to claim 13, wherein in metalizing the initial bit lines, the method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure further comprises: metalizing the initial transition layer.

15. The method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure according to claim 12, wherein the forming a first dielectric layer comprises:forming an initial first dielectric layer, the initial first dielectric layer surrounding sidewalls of the semiconductor channels, and a fourth interval being provided between parts of the initial first dielectric layer located on sidewalls of adjacent semiconductor channels on a same initial bit line;forming a first isolation layer, the first isolation layer filling up the fourth intervals, and a material of the first isolation layer being different from a material of the initial first dielectric layer;etching a part of the initial first dielectric layer until exposing sidewalls of the second doped regions;forming a second isolation layer, the second isolation layer surrounding the sidewalls of the second doped regions and being located on a sidewall of the first isolation layer, and a part of the second isolation layer located on the sidewalls of the second doped regions and a part of the second isolation layer located on the sidewall of the first isolation layer forming through holes together, a part of the initial first dielectric layer being exposed at bottoms of the through holes; and a material of the second isolation layer is different from the material of the initial first dielectric layer; andremoving a part of the initial first dielectric layer exposed by the through holes and located on sidewalls of the channel regions, and a remaining part of the initial first dielectric layer being used as the first dielectric layer.

16. The method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure according to claim 15, wherein the forming an insulating layer comprises:thermally oxidizing the sidewalls of the channel regions exposed, to form the insulating layer, and the insulating layer covering sidewall surfaces of the remaining parts of the channel regions, and fifth intervals being provided between the insulating layer and the first isolation layer.

17. The method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure according to claim 16, wherein the forming word lines comprises:forming initial word lines, the initial word lines filling up the fifth intervals and the through holes, and the initial word lines being also located between parts of the insulating layer covering sidewalls of channel regions on adjacent initial bit lines; andremoving parts of the initial word lines located in the through holes, and remaining parts of the initial word lines being used as the word lines.

18. The method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure according to claim 12, wherein the forming a first dielectric layer comprises:forming an initial first dielectric layer, the initial first dielectric layer surrounding sidewalls of the semiconductor channels, and a fourth interval being provided between parts of the initial first dielectric layer located on sidewalls of adjacent semiconductor channels on a same initial bit line;forming a first isolation layer, the first isolation layer filling up the fourth intervals, and a material of the first isolation layer being different from a material of the initial first dielectric layer; andetching a part of the initial first dielectric layer until exposing sidewalls of the second doped regions and sidewalls of the channel regions, and a remaining part of the initial first dielectric layer being used as the first dielectric layer.

19. The method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure according to claim 18, wherein the forming an insulating layer and the forming a second dielectric layer comprise:forming a protective layer covering the sidewalls of the second doped regions and the sidewalls of the channel regions, and sixth intervals being provided between the protective layer and the first isolation layer, a part of the protective layer on the sidewalls of the channel regions being the insulating layer, a part of the protective layer covering the sidewalls of the second doped regions being the second dielectric layer.

20. The method of manufacturing a semiconductor structure according to claim 19, wherein the forming word lines comprises:forming initial word lines, the initial word lines filling up the sixth intervals, and the initial word lines being also located between parts of the protective layer covering parts of the sidewalls of the semiconductor channels on adjacent initial bit lines; andremoving parts of the initial word lines, and remaining parts of the initial word lines being used as the word lines, the word lines only surrounding a sidewall of the insulating layer located on the sidewalls of the channel regions.
